item.title: Comment on Galaxy’s Edge Magazine Annual Subscription by Gavin
item.dc:creator: Gavin
item.description:
Hi Hank, your issues can always be downloaded in all available formats from your Library: https://weightlessbooks.com/my-library/
I don't know anything about Bookgrabbr — you'd have to ask the publishers themselves on their site: http://www.galaxysedge.com/
item.content:encoded:
Hi Hank, your issues can always be downloaded in all available formats from your Library: https://weightlessbooks.com/my-library/

I don’t know anything about Bookgrabbr — you’d have to ask the publishers themselves on their site: http://www.galaxysedge.com/

item.title: Comment on Galaxy’s Edge Magazine Annual Subscription by hankroberts
item.dc:creator: hankroberts
item.description:
The new Galaxy's Edge is out per email from Phoenix, but their website is pushing signing up with some site that requires Facebook or Twitter IDs --bookdroppr, something like that.
Where's the new issue email link?
item.content:encoded:
The new Galaxy’s Edge is out per email from Phoenix, but their website is pushing signing up with some site that requires Facebook or Twitter IDs –bookdroppr, something like that.

Where’s the new issue email link?

item.title: Comment on The Magazine of Fantasy and Science Fiction – 6 Issue Subscription by dokhebi
item.dc:creator: dokhebi
item.description: Can I pay for a subscription now and have it start later? I have an existing F&FS subscription that ends soon but I want to pay for a digital subscription now so I don't forget.
item.content:encoded: Can I pay for a subscription now and have it start later? I have an existing F&FS subscription that ends soon but I want to pay for a digital subscription now so I don’t forget.

item.title: Comment on Welcome: The Magazine of Fantasy and Science Fiction by Spilogale Inc.
item.dc:creator: Spilogale Inc.
item.description:
Greybeard, we plan to put out electronic copies of all our back issues, but I'm afraid it will be a while before they're all ready to go. In the meantime, your best bet for finding older issues of F&SF is to try the secondary market---online auction sites and used booksellers.
---Gordon Van Gelder, F&SF
item.content:encoded:
Greybeard, we plan to put out electronic copies of all our back issues, but I’m afraid it will be a while before they’re all ready to go. In the meantime, your best bet for finding older issues of F&SF is to try the secondary market—online auction sites and used booksellers.

—Gordon Van Gelder, F&SF
